data.title: Visual detail: Scripts name highlighting
data.body:
As the title says it's just a really little visual detail I'm talking about
In the script opened window the scripts are highlighted w/ a red like surface, but if the name is
too long to be completely contained the red surface doesn't highlight the complete name:

http://gyazo.govanify.com/grab/8ca4b6.png

For this reason I think the surface should be a little bit bigger, covering the whole area of the name, maybe by using a more rectagular shpaed transparent  selector

data.title: WindowDialog theme options missing titlebar
data.body:
Right now the only options to theme the windows ui are the ones that appear in the image
![window-ui](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/11880777/7c708e58-a4e1-11e5-9ec7-70e1b10f48ba.png)

Just a couple of missing features / bugs
1ยบ There are no options to change the style of the titlebar. When you style the window with a custom theme the titlebar just disappears. 
2ยบ The option titlebar_height does not increase the titlebar height.
3ยบ The close button textures can be changed, but the button mask is still very very small and it can not be changed (it can be moved using offsets tough).

data.title: LineEdit - missing caret blink
data.body: I miss the caret blink in LineEdit, sometimes I think godot crashed. Is it possible to add this as optional to save resources if needed?

data.title: Add a global function to get the type of variant.
data.body:
So we can check the variant type and do something.

```
    if typeof(obj) == TYPE_OBJECT:
        print(obj.get_type())
```

data.title: A strange problem with KinematicBody2D's colliding body.
data.body:
I write a little demo to show this problem.
https://github.com/dbsGen/CollidingTest
In the demo, I make a mark at the colliding position, and some time the KinematicBody2D's colliding position is different with others.

data.title: Slider/SpinBox values.
data.body:
When using sliders (HSlider and VSlider. And applies to SpinBox as well.), I noticed two small quirks that could be subject to discussion. Specifically in the case of using integers/ "Rounded values".

The second thing is that the limits for the sliders seem reasonable for floats, but 65535 seems like a very low number for integers. While multiplication tricks could be used to get around this limit, it could become cumbersome when the numbers could get large like money or experience points. Seems the only way to get exact integers over 65535 is using a LineEdit, but that'd require accounting for possible non-numeric characters the user may accidentally input.

Is there something that could be done for this?

data.title: Fix Remove Item option in TileSet plugin
data.body:
Fixes #3088

This seems like the best way to handle tiles deletion for now. Perhaps the TileSet editor plugin may be improved in the future, allowing to select tiles (among other features).

It will display a dialog asking for a tile name or id (the name has priority when checking).

data.title: Added metadata to TileSet tiles and MeshLibrary items
data.body:
Requested by #2753.

Notice I didn't add the close/fixed prefix because it's currently only possible to add meta via code.

There is no Dictionary property hint, so in my tests I tried displaying a json string (with multiline property hint) of the meta for editing it in the inspector. It worked fine, but it didn't seem like the right way to do it.

Hopefully the new TileSet importer will allow editing meta visually (perhaps we could help with this).

NOTE: This PR does not include descriptions in _classes.xml_ for the new methods.

data.title: TileSet editor plugin: Remove Selected Item won't work
data.body:
When editing a TileSet resource on the editor, there is a "Theme" menu with some options. Among them, there is an option called _Remove Selected Item_, which doesn't work (it won't pass [this condition](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/08cab3a17a4eba874c17cec41425f149846663a4/tools/editor/plugins/tile_set_editor_plugin.cpp#L180)).
It makes sense, since there is no way to select a specific tile in the inspector.

data.title: Redundant "Theme" button shown during edition of TileSet property of Tilemap node
data.body:
Just edit "Tile set" property of Tilemap node. Reproduced in 69c79c0d4a6107313c24fa1202d9709551d95c03 build

**_Other places where this happens:**_
- Same steps to reproduce on **MeshLibrary** editor in GridMap node (thanks TheHX)

Short vid to clarify on how to reproduce: https://youtu.be/IBNAwJMCrc0
As well as screenshot:
![rect4162](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/11820641/c90b5b62-a365-11e5-9138-f2b5d1010016.png)

data.title: Mouse cursor visibility does not work with custom mouse cursor
data.body:
If you add a custom mouse cursor, then the mouse mode is set to `hidden`, even though the custom cursor is visible (my guess is that this hides the OS cursor). But that also means there's no way to hide the custom cursor.

If you try to show the mouse cursor (via `Input.set_mouse_mode()`), it will then show the OS mouse cursor on top of the custom one.

This can be quickly checked by setting a custom cursor in the Window Management demo and pressing `<Esc>` to grab and release the mouse. The custom cursor will still be visible after the grab and the OS cursor will be visible after releasing the mouse.

(This may be Linux only, as I have not tested in other platforms).

data.title: Ability to define template for empty class
data.body:
It would be nice to have ability to define template file for empty class. 
From irc Reduz would like to have this in 2.1

data.title: "Script" property from "Editor settings" should be erased/hidden
data.body:
I was messing today with "script" property from Godot editor settings. Don't know what it does but I was able accidentally  erase all my editor settings :)
From what Reduz said on irc, this property "probably should not be there"  and ask me to open an issue as a reminder. 
So hide this from gui or document it :)
Will label this as a bug since touching this property can be quite harmful.
![script_in_editor_settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/11819012/e6ecb73c-a35d-11e5-8447-f3f6258c8d41.png)

data.title: Add editor setting for display mode on file dialog and filesystem dock
data.body:
Add a editor settings for choosing the display mode of EditorFileDialog, similar to the hidden folder setting.

Closes #2179.

data.title: Custom mouse pointer hotspot not working
data.body:
Custom mouse pointer hotspot is not working as far as I tested. The value keeps pointing coords 0,0 no matter what.

After closing and opening the project again the hotspot option is unchecked and weirdly, in different position in the list of preferences.

data.title: [TRACKER] Internationalization-related issues (CJK and RTL support, IME, fonts, etc.)
data.body:
We have quite a few issues and PRs (both new and old) related to internationalization issues, especially CJK and Arabic input and display support, input method engines, etc., so I thought to list them all here so that a global solution can be discussed and implemented.

**Issues:**
- [x] #29: IME support for non-latin Unicode characters (CJK, Arabic, etc.) 
- [x] #531: Default font in editor is non-unicode
- [x] #871: Godot editor accepts non-ascii chars but doesn't show them
- [ ] #982: Support for RTL input and display
- [x] #1708: Can't import template if folder contains non-ascii characters
- [x] #1848: RichTextLabel does not support wrapping for Chinese font
- [x] #2379: International font problem with OptionButton
- [x] #2491: Cannot display CJK properly on linux
- [ ] #2689: Alt codes arenโt picked up by text 
- [ ] #2915: Missing support for non-ascii keyboard bindings
- [ ] #9961: Add HarfBuzz for text shaping

**Pull requests:**
- #194: Fixed issue #29 Editor doesn't support CJK **(closed)**
- #245: Split font atlas texture into 1024*1024 size if atlas size > 1024 **(merge conflicts, closed)**
- #257: New add dynamic ttf loading support **(closed, obsoleted by 2.1 developments)**
- #287: Add editor localization support (WIP) **(closed, obsoleted by 2.1 developments)**
- #300: Fix CJK input on ios platform **(merge conflicts)**
- #2297: Add RTL text support and fa locale **(closed, was using copylefted code apparently)**
- #2799: Add character selection to font importer **(merge conflicts)**
- #2886: RTL support based on ICU library **(merge conflicts, but could likely get rebased if asked for)**

data.title: Prevent deleting input presets as it does not work
data.body:
Follow-up of #3076.
Now the only thing possible to do with input presets is to add/remove key bindings. It was already the case previously but it's now clearer in the UI.

data.title: User set boot_splash gone on Android when checking Compress to RAM
data.body:
In Godot 1.1(stable) when using 'Compress to RAM (BC/PVRTC/ETC)' option in 'Project Export Settings' and exporting to android device (by pressing android button above help tab) my own splash (boot_splash set in 'Project Settings') was gone. At start the default Godot logo was displayed. 
When exporting to Linux boot_splash is displayed correctly.

data.title: Avoid project manager from processing gamepad input
data.body: Closes #1415.

data.title: Ability to convert scenes to full fledged "Node Plugins"
data.body:
Since we have ability to save scenes to file, and attach them to the scene like almost any ordinary
predefined node, the next natural step would be to to allow people to convert these scenes into some kind of "node plugin" that could be shared even more easly between projects in more easily and 'standardized' way than currently. 
Basically when we put 'Node Plugin' folder somewhere inside the project folder, editor should automatically detect it (or allow to add it from settings) and add proper entry in "Create new node" window.  (Additionally  there could be a folder inside ~/.godot/ that would collect all the 'node plugins' for use in all our projects without the need to define them in each project separately)

Couple observations:
- There is need for some kind of 'public/protected' modifier for gdscript, to disallow users changing internal state of 'plugin node' in not planned way.
- Scripts that are added to root node of plugin should not be visible in inspector, and user should be able to define it's own script for this node if he need (just like it's with build in nodes) (I assume this script should by default extend after the script from 'plugin node').
- There should be possibility to contain more than one 'Node definition' inside single plugin. Some plugins might require to operate on higher amount of node types in order to work (i.e. StateMachine node might need to operate on 'State' nodes). Guess the easiest way to achieve this might be to simply allow to define main folder that contain more than one 'root node plugin' at the same level (referencing to other plugins(node types) would be easy thanks to relative paths).  
- In "Create new node" window there should be some kind of separator to separate build in nodes, from those that comes from the plugins folder.
- Other things that need to be considered is to allow plugin creator to define an icon for 'plugin node'
- Godot help system should be able to display descriptions written by plugin creators for public functions, members, signals and the plugin itself. 
- I know that there are currently available "editor plugins", which allows developers to write widgets that are used by Godot editor itself. It might be good idea to allow distribute 'scene plugins' together with these editor ones in a transparent - not noticeable for user - way, since I can imagine someone might want to write 'node plugin' that might be editable only via editor plugin.
- Creating a plugin should not be very complicated process and should allow developers to gain better reusability of some parts of the project (even if they want these plugins only for internal use like "Enemy" node, and thanks to help system developers could easily document those plugins for their less technical co-workers).
- Node plugins should not be allowed to be created, if they are using any resource that is located  outside of the main folder for given plugin. Thus all paths should be relative, and all inner scenes should be located inside plugin folder.
- As an exception from above,  there should be possibility to define plugin that is depended on another plugin (one or more).
- It also seems that nodes that are part of the editor plugin should not be visible from the outside world (someone who is using plugin node as a root node for it's scene could be very surprised by what  get_children() is returning). Some random idea: As alternative provide some global way to set node visibility as ?public/protected/private? In this case I don't have clear idea how this exactly should work, and be represented in editor right now, guess some feedback from main devs is needed. 
- Idea on how creation of such plugin could look: Scene -> convert to plugin option. After selecting, some kind of simple wizard/guide could be launched that would validate scene and look for not relative paths in .gd (?or resources that are outside the folder?) and show validation alerts. There also could be some short "howto" in this place, as well as other necessary steps (depending on idea implementation: i.e file icon chose, pointing out which folder is a main folder for the plugin as a whole, etc).
- Sounds like implementation of some of these things would require some additions to gdscipt. I know that in 2.1 there are plans to add new scripting language with static typing, maybe creation of 'node plugins' should be possible when using this new language? 
- Also this would be some start point for developers to create more generic, **encapsulated** scenes that could be more easily shared on the upcoming asset store. 

These ideas in their core are currently generally achievable by using some rules when creating scenes. This feature request is opened more in hope to standardize some things and make them more automatic, native and pleasant to use. 

**Edit: Further (maybe little crazy) ideas:**
- It's totally possible currently to write 'subscene', that in order to work need some other node that is delivered by the user from editor depending on the situation (currently we can just add a node to the scene loaded from file, or click 'edit' button and add node to any child of subscene). But there are some problems with this approach: 
  - first of all, the user need to know internal structure of the node-plugin, it need to know where to add given node and how to name it.
  - Node-plugins by it's nature should hide it's internal implementation from the outside world
    This problem might be partially solved by exported variables, but this is not always straightforward (for example plugin could want from user to provide Position3D nodes to point some concrete transform).
  - Because of all this it would be cool if there could be an ability to define plugin-placeholder nodes, that would be visible as a childrens of a plugin-node when it's added to the editor (All other children are hidden). Thanks to these nodes user will be able to 'inject' some concrete nodes  inside the plugin by replacing those placeholders. 
  - Another approach to this problem would be to just give ability for selected nodes to be visible in scene tree editor as a child of node-plugin. (Not involving any kind of placeholder concept), this would allow users to modify these concrete internal nodes ([move]/[scale]/[add new child] - exactly the same way how it's possible currently with any child when SubScene is editable).

data.title: Option to rename input actions
data.body:
Closes #517

Since it used the same dialog as editor layouts, I renamed it to EditorNameDialog to make it more generic.

![Screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/11785694/44a0c480-a283-11e5-92cc-464b7ef3ee9f.png)

data.title: Fix editor layouts broken
data.body: Regression from 9a7ff65

data.title: Editor layout dialog: name field grabs focus on popup
data.body:
Solves little usability issue I noticed with the save/delete editor layout dialog.
Also renamed wrong file name comment on the header (sorry about that :P).

data.title: Implement double-click on remaining dialogs
data.body:
As suggested by @akien-mga on #3061. Implemented on:
- Import subscene dialog
- Editor dir dialog

data.title: Import > Sub-Scene is confusingly named
data.body:
The "sub-scene" term is used in several places but can be quite confusing to newcomers und especially developers new to Godot's scene system, see e.g. this Facebook post: https://www.facebook.com/groups/godotengine/permalink/703042476499016/

The PR #2928 based on @Fiona's proposal already moves the "Export -> Sub-Scene" menu entry to an icon in the scene tree panel ("Create new scene from node(s)"), but the "Import -> Sub-Scene" entry could also use some love.

As this import function actually seems to _copy_ the selected nodes of a scene to the current scene, a name like "Import nodes from scene" would be more explicit.

data.title: New and corrected area override modes.
data.body:
AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE has been split into two constants:
- _COMBINE_REPLACE, which works like the current _REPLACE, adding its grav/fric, then stops processing areas.
- _REPLACE, which replaces grav/fric with its own values, then stops processing areas.

There also is a new space override mode:
- _REPLACE_COMBINE, which replaces grav/fric with its own values, but keeps processing areas.

This has been done for both 2D and 3D areas. Documentation is still being written.

data.title: -w switch is not in effect when opening projects from the project manager
data.body: The new -w switch works properly for opening a scene with "godot -e -w scene.scn", but if opening the project from the project manager, it will try to maximize like if the switch wasn't in effect.

data.title: CollisionPolygon2D doesn't display colors per generated quadrangle
data.body:
Not sure of the "quadrangle" here. But look at this example : using Godot 1.1
![allthecolors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4671710/11768914/8347527e-a1db-11e5-8ee9-6e9e6887e1a5.png)
and now, with latest 2.x :
![onlybluecolor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4671710/11768944/7771c96a-a1dc-11e5-9975-71d2d38ad0bf.png)

This is the same scene, in which there is a sprite for the background, with a CollisionPolygon2D drawn on top of it, for having "solid" walls for interaction wiht the player. I suppose this is not a totally 100% correct workflow, but it works.
The colors were very useful, because the CollisionPolygon2D generates all those "quadrangles", i think this is the same be it in 1.x and 2.x ? Anyway there are some rare cases where one quadrangle is not drawn correctly and the collisions are ignored for that buggy area, which can be corrected by moving/adding some points in order to generate the missing quadrangle.

data.title: ERR_HANDLER_SCRIPT never used to raise "script errors"?
data.body:
When implementing some better formatting for the error output in #2737, I noticed that there should be a "SCRIPT ERROR" message when encountering errors in scripts:
- in `OS::ErrorType`: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/cc7880f/core/os/os.h#L116
- and then in `OS::print_err`: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/cc7880f/core/os/os.cpp#L68

But I think `OS::print_err` is never called with the `ERR_SCRIPT` error type actually, so all "script errors" are raised as normal errors and can't be differentiated from engine errors.

There is apparently no `SCRIPT_ERR_PRINT` macro similar to `ERR_PRINT` and `WARN_PRINT` in core/error_macros.h, though there is a `ERR_HANDLER_SCRIPT` enum value: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/cc7880f/core/error_macros.h#L52

data.title: Do not open scripts on external editor on scene tab switch
data.body:
If use external editor is enabled, when opening a scene, the editor will open all the scripts with the external editor.
That's fine, the problem is that the editor will also open all these scripts when switching the scene tab, causing the external editor to steal the window focus, which is very annoying.
